metadata.chief_complaint: ear infection recheck, not improving, medication change needed

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Hi, back for the ear recheck. How's Ella doing?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Not great. She's still complaining that her ear hurts. I don't think the antibiotic is working.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: She's been on amoxicillin for how many days now?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Seven days. She has three left.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: And she's been taking it consistently? Twice a day?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, every single dose. I set alarms.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good. Let me take a look at her ears.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Ella, I'm going to look in your ears with my light, okay?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Left ear looks good. Right ear... still has fluid and the eardrum is still red. There's some bulging too.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: So it didn't work?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: The amoxicillin isn't clearing this one. It happens sometimes, especially if the bacteria are resistant. We need to switch to a stronger antibiotic.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: What's the stronger one?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'm going to prescribe Augmentin. It's amoxicillin plus another ingredient that helps it work against resistant bacteria.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Is it also a liquid?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Yes, same pink liquid but a different formula. She'll take it twice a day for ten days.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Does she finish the old one first?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: No, stop the amoxicillin and start the Augmentin right away.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Will this one definitely work?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Augmentin works on most resistant ear infections. If she's not better in three to four days, call me. But I expect this will do the trick.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Should I bring her back again to recheck?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Only if she's still having symptoms after finishing the Augmentin. If she improves and stays well, no need.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Okay. I'll start it tonight.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good. Give it with food, it's easier on the stomach. And keep up with Tylenol or Motrin for the pain.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Thanks, Doctor. Hopefully this does it.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: It should. Feel better, Ella.
